org.pcc.pams.objects

Class Bubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pcc.pams.objects.PhysicsObject
      • org.pcc.pams.objects.Bubble

  • public class Bubble
extends PhysicsObject
    Represents a floating bubble.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static double DENSITY
      The bubble's physical density, used to calculate its mass.
      static double MAX_RADIUS
      The maximum permissible radius for a bubble.
      static double MAX_SPEED
      The maximum speed the bubble can reach (by norm).

      The bubble's radius.

    • Method Detail

      • calcCollisionSpeed

        private static Vector2d calcCollisionSpeed(Bubble bubble,
                                           Bubble otherBubble)
        Calculates the resultant speed from a collision with another bubble.
        Parameters:
        bubble - The first colliding bubble, to calculate the speed for.
        otherBubble - The second colliding bubble.
        Returns:
        Returns the new speed for bubble.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Calculates the color of the bubble based on its speed and returns it.
        Returns:
        The color of the bubble.

        Returns the radius of the bubble.
        Returns:
        The bubble's radius.

      • getMass

        public double getMass()
        Calculates and returns the bubble's mass. The "mass" is used in physics collision calculations.
        Returns:
        The bubble's mass.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(Vector2d newSpeed)
        Changes the bubble's speed, ensuring it is smaller than the max speed.
        Overrides:
        setSpeed in class PhysicsObject
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - The new speed to apply.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Vector2d otherOrigin,
                          double otherRadius)
        Checks if the bubble intersects with a specified "virtual" bubble.
        Parameters:
        otherOrigin - The virtual bubble's origin.
        otherRadius - The virtual bubble's radius.
        Returns:
        True if it intersects, false otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Fan fan)
        Checks if the bubble intersects with the fan's cone of wind. To simplify calculations, we only check if the center of the circle is in the triangle, since this is where the force gets applied. We do not care about the cone's length either, since we are assuming it has infinite reach.
        Parameters:
        fan - The fan to check against.
        Returns:
        True if it intersects, false otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Bubble otherBubble)
        Checks if the bubble intersects with another bubble.
        Parameters:
        otherBubble - The other bubble to check for intersection.
        Returns:
        True if they intersect, false otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Wall wall)
        Checks if the bubble intersects with the wall.
        Parameters:
        wall - The wall to check.
        Returns:
        True if they intersect, false otherwise.

      • collide

        public void collide(Bubble otherBubble)
        Applies a collision to this bubble and the colliding bubble.
        Parameters:
        otherBubble - The other bubble to apply the collision to.

      • collide

        public void collide(Wall wall)
        Apply collision effects to this bubble.
        Parameters:
        wall - The wall this bubble is colliding with.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the bubble.
